posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: Does anyone know how reliable and if there is a certain orientation we have to have the gyro. Also does anyone have examples of the code in Java?

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked:
We are using one this year and the implementation is the same as a regular navX as far as I understand. There are many examples you can find here - Examples | navX-MXP

We mounted the navX2-micro at the dead center and bottom of our robot just to make sure all our rotation motion is accurate. So I do not know how to adjust if you’re off center or not laying flat.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: How bad is the sensor drift

posts.name: Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374
posts.cooked:
NavX can be in any orientation that is orthogonal to gravity – i.e. one side or top/bottom of the unit MUST be perpendicular to gravity.    You will need to use the OmniMount feature so the NavX correctly interprets its directions.

As to location on the bot, we have had success with various locations.  Low and central on the bot is “best” and “recommended” by Kauai  Labs and most here on CD – but we have had decent experience in other locations without huge impacts on accuracy.
posts.display_username: Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374

posts.cooked: What type of output port does it use on the rio

reply_to_user.name: Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374

posts.name: Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374
posts.cooked: We have only used the MXP version, not the micro.  But the orientation issues are I think the same.  Micro is of course easier to locate anywhere – MXP is usually on the Roborio.
posts.display_username: Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked: The micro uses either I2C or microUSB.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: Have you had problems with your gyro being to close to your motors or drive motors and giving inaccurate readings?

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked:
Good question! Unintentionally the gyro is not located near any motors minus a NEO550 that we hardly ever use.

So we have not experienced any issues with inaccurate readings, but that is nothing something we considered when we installed the gyro.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: I read that you could calibrate it to still work with motor’s running around it do you know if this is true and how had it would be to do?

posts.name: burde1jb
posts.cooked: I hope someone else is able to answer your question as that is above my pay grade. I wish you luck!
